bug.short_desc: [Cinnamon] Firefox uses white text color on grey background for mouse-over in menus
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1222614 screenshot
Description of problem: Firefox uses white text color on a grey background for mouse-over in menus. This is very difficult to read. See attached screenshot.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): firefox-50.0-1.fc25.x86_64 cinnamon-3.0.7-3.fc25.x86_64
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open Firefox 2. Open a menu and let the mouse over an menu item. The text color is changed to white.
Actual results: White text color on grey background
Expected results: Any other color combination that is better to read.

Can you please test latest nightly which is at:
https://archive.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/nightly/latest-mozilla-central/firefox-53.0a1.en-US.linux-x86_64.tar.bz2
Thanks.

Created attachment 1222648 screenshot nightly
The nightly does not have this problem. The mouse-over event sets a blue background for the selected menu item. See attached screenshot.
